dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Hola, Pedro. ¿Cómo te sientes hoy?
dialog.english: Hello, Pedro. How do you feel today?

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Estoy un poco mal. Me duele la cabeza y tengo fiebre.
dialog.english: I'm a little unwell. My head hurts and I have a fever.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Lo siento mucho. ¿Fuiste al médico?
dialog.english: I'm so sorry. Did you go to the doctor?

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Sí, fui ayer. Él me dio medicina. Tengo que tomarla.
dialog.english: Yes, I went yesterday. He gave me medicine. I have to take it.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Espero que te sientas mejor pronto.
dialog.english: I hope you feel better soon.

dialog.speaker: Médico
dialog.spanish: Buenos días. ¿Qué le duele?
dialog.english: Good morning. What hurts?

dialog.speaker: Paciente
dialog.spanish: Doctor, me duele el estómago. Me sentí mal anoche.
dialog.english: Doctor, my stomach hurts. I felt sick last night.

dialog.speaker: Médico
dialog.spanish: Ya veo. También veo que tiene un poco de fiebre.
dialog.english: I see. I also see that you have a little fever.

dialog.speaker: Paciente
dialog.spanish: Sí, y me siento muy cansado.
dialog.english: Yes, and I feel very tired.

dialog.speaker: Médico
dialog.spanish: Tiene que descansar y tomar esta medicina. Vaya a la farmacia.
dialog.english: You have to rest and take this medicine. Go to the pharmacy.

dialog.speaker: Farmacéutico
dialog.spanish: Buenas tardes. ¿Cómo puedo ayudarle?
dialog.english: Good afternoon. How can I help you?

dialog.speaker: Cliente
dialog.spanish: Quiero algo para el dolor de cabeza, por favor.
dialog.english: I want something for a headache, please.

dialog.speaker: Farmacéutico
dialog.spanish: Claro. ¿Usted tiene otros síntomas?
dialog.english: Of course. Do you have other symptoms?

dialog.speaker: Cliente
dialog.spanish: Sí. Estoy un poco débil y me duele la garganta.
dialog.english: Yes. I am a little weak and my throat hurts.

dialog.speaker: Farmacéutico
dialog.spanish: Aquí está esta medicina. Tómela cada ocho horas.
dialog.english: Here is this medicine. Take it every eight hours.

questions.question: ¿Qué quiere el cliente?
options: Algo para el dolor de cabeza
questions.answer: Algo para el dolor de cabeza

questions.question: ¿Qué otros síntomas tiene el cliente?
options: Se siente débil y le duele la garganta
questions.answer: Se siente débil y le duele la garganta

questions.question: ¿Cada cuánto tiempo debe tomar la medicina?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Me siento muy bien hoy. Hice ejercicio esta mañana.
dialog.english: I feel very well today. I exercised this morning.

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bueno! Yo no hice ejercicio hoy, pero comí sano.
dialog.english: How good! I didn't exercise today, but I ate healthy.

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Hacer ejercicio y comer sano es muy importante para la salud.
dialog.english: Exercising and eating healthy is very important for health.

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: Tienes razón. ¿Qué comiste hoy?
dialog.english: You are right. What did you eat today?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Comí una ensalada y pescado. Fue muy delicioso.
dialog.english: I ate a salad and fish. It was very delicious.

questions.question: ¿Qué es importante para la salud, según Juan?

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué te pasó en la pierna?
dialog.english: What happened to your leg?

dialog.speaker: Marta
dialog.spanish: Me caí y me duele la pierna mucho.
dialog.english: I fell and my leg hurts a lot.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: ¡Ay, qué mal! ¿Necesitas ir al hospital?
dialog.english: Oh no, that's bad! Do you need to go to the hospital?

dialog.speaker: Marta
dialog.spanish: No lo sé. La semana pasada también me caí y me dolió el brazo.
dialog.english: I don't know. Last week I also fell and my arm hurt.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Parece que necesitas tener más cuidado.
dialog.english: It seems like you need to be more careful.

questions.question: ¿Qué le pasó a Marta la semana pasada?
options: Se cayó y se dolió el brazo
Se cayó y se dolió la pierna
questions.answer: Se cayó y se dolió el brazo

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Necesitas tener más cuidado'?
options: You need to go to the doctor
You need to be more careful
You need to go to the hospital
questions.answer: You need to be more careful

sentences.spanish: Hoy me levanté y me sentí muy mal. Tenía dolor de cabeza y todo el cuerpo me dolía.
sentences.english: Today I woke up and felt very unwell. I had a headache and my whole body hurt.

sentences.spanish: Mi esposa me dijo, 'Tienes que ir al médico'. Fui al hospital.
sentences.english: My wife told me, 'You have to go to the doctor'. I went to the hospital.

sentences.spanish: El médico me hizo unas preguntas. '¿Desde cuándo se siente así?' me preguntó.
sentences.english: The doctor asked me some questions. 'Since when have you been feeling this way?' he asked me.

sentences.spanish: Yo le dije que me sentí mal desde la mañana. Él me diagnosticó la gripe.
sentences.english: I told him that I felt sick since the morning. He diagnosed me with the flu.

sentences.spanish: Él me dio una receta para la medicina. Ahora tengo que ir a la farmacia.
sentences.english: He gave me a prescription for medicine. Now I have to go to the pharmacy.

sentences.spanish: Espero que la medicina me ayude a sentirme mejor pronto.
sentences.english: I hope the medicine helps me feel better soon.

sentences.spanish: Estaba en el parque con mis amigos. Jugábamos al fútbol y la pasábamos bien.
sentences.english: I was at the park with my friends. We were playing soccer and having a good time.

sentences.spanish: Corrí muy rápido y me caí. Caí en mi brazo y me dolió mucho.
sentences.english: I ran very fast and I fell. I fell on my arm and it hurt a lot.

sentences.spanish: Mis amigos me ayudaron a levantarme. Mi brazo estaba hinchado.
sentences.english: My friends helped me get up. My arm was swollen.

sentences.spanish: Fui al hospital. El médico me dijo que no era nada grave.
sentences.english: I went to the hospital. The doctor told me it was nothing serious.

sentences.spanish: Ahora tengo un yeso en el brazo. No me duele tanto como antes.
sentences.english: Now I have a cast on my arm. It doesn't hurt as much as before.

sentences.spanish: Tengo que tener cuidado en el futuro cuando juego al fútbol.
sentences.english: I have to be careful in the future when I play soccer.

sentences.spanish: La salud es muy importante. Es necesario cuidar nuestro cuerpo.
sentences.english: Health is very important. It is necessary to take care of our body.

sentences.spanish: Yo siempre hago ejercicio y como comida sana. No me siento enfermo casi nunca.
sentences.english: I always exercise and eat healthy food. I almost never feel sick.

sentences.spanish: Mi hermano, en cambio, no hace ejercicio y come mucha comida chatarra.
sentences.english: My brother, on the other hand, does not exercise and eats a lot of junk food.

sentences.spanish: Él siempre se siente cansado y tiene dolor de estómago a menudo.
sentences.english: He always feels tired and often has a stomach ache.

sentences.spanish: La semana pasada, mi hermano fue al médico porque estaba muy débil.
sentences.english: Last week, my brother went to the doctor because he was very weak.

sentences.spanish: El médico le dijo que tiene que cambiar sus hábitos. La salud es un tesoro.
sentences.english: The doctor told him that he has to change his habits. Health is a treasure.

speaking.title: La Salud y el Cuerpo
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas para hablar sobre la salud, síntomas y el cuerpo humano.

answer.spanish: Me siento un poco cansado.
answer.english: I feel a little tired.

answer.spanish: Me duele la cabeza y el pie.
answer.english: My head and my foot hurt.

question.english: Why are you at the pharmacy?

answer.spanish: Necesito comprar medicina para mi dolor de garganta.
answer.english: I need to buy medicine for my sore throat.

answer.spanish: Tengo tos y un poco de fiebre.
answer.english: I have a cough and a little fever.

question.english: Did you go to the doctor?

answer.spanish: Sí, fui al médico ayer. Me dio una receta.
answer.english: Yes, I went to the doctor yesterday. He gave me a prescription.

question.english: How do you take care of your health?

answer.spanish: Yo como sano y hago ejercicio.
answer.english: I eat healthy and I exercise.

question.english: What part of the body hurts?

answer.spanish: Me duele la espalda después de trabajar.
answer.english: My back hurts after working.

answer.spanish: Significa 'I am sick'.
answer.english: It means 'I am sick'.

answer.spanish: Sí, me siento muy débil. No tengo energía.
answer.english: Yes, I feel very weak. I don't have energy.

answer.spanish: No, no tengo dolor de cabeza a menudo.
answer.english: No, I don't have headaches often.

answer.spanish: Un médico trabaja en el hospital o en un consultorio.
answer.english: A doctor works in the hospital or in an office.

question.english: Do you need a doctor's appointment?

answer.spanish: Sí, necesito una cita para la próxima semana.
answer.english: Yes, I need an appointment for next week.

question.spanish: ¿Qué te duele más, el brazo o la pierna?
question.english: What hurts more, your arm or your leg?

answer.spanish: La pierna me duele más que el brazo.
answer.english: My leg hurts more than my arm.

answer.spanish: La gripe es una enfermedad con fiebre y dolor de cuerpo.
answer.english: The flu is an illness with a fever and body aches.

answer.spanish: Sí, me siento mucho mejor que ayer.
answer.english: Yes, I feel much better than yesterday.

question.english: What did you do to feel better?

answer.spanish: Descansé mucho y tomé medicina.
answer.english: I rested a lot and took medicine.

question.english: What happens if you have an allergy?

answer.spanish: Si tengo una alergia, estornudo y me duelen los ojos.
answer.english: If I have an allergy, I sneeze and my eyes hurt.

answer.spanish: Una receta es un papel del médico para la medicina.
answer.english: A prescription is a paper from the doctor for medicine.

answer.spanish: Un resfriado es una enfermedad común con tos y estornudos.
answer.english: A cold is a common illness with a cough and sneezing.

answer.spanish: La semana pasada me dolieron los oídos y el cuello.
answer.english: Last week my ears and neck hurt.
